newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada daily lumber export figures to U.S..
newsitem.headline: Canada daily lumber export figures to U.S..

text.p: Canada softwood lumber exports to the United States as of 0001 EST on February 10 in board feet, according to data from the Canadian Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade:
For the Jan 1 - March 31 quarter:
Province BC Alberta Ontario Quebec Total
bonus 3.74 million 6.72 million 4.17 million 16.20 million 30.83 million
EB 645.04 million 79.55 million 105.5 million 171.83 million 1.00 bln
LFB 2.65 million 0.95 million 7.69 million 30.94 million 42.24 million
UFB 0.61 million 4.02 million 10.44 million 27.98 million 43.04 million
Pct exported: EB - 6.81, LFB - 6.49
For the Oct 1 - Dec 31 quarter:
Province BC Alberta Ontario Quebec Total
bonus 6.05 million 7.66 million 9.25 million 51.09 million 74.05 million
EB 2.09 bln 302.99million 402.61 million 883.48 million 3.68 bln
LFB 2.72 million 7.15 million 5.39 million 11.38 million 26.64 million
UFB 6.60 million 6.90 million 3.61 million 25.61 million 42.72 million
Pct exported: EB - 25.04, LFB - 4.09
April 1 - present:
Province BC Alberta Ontario Quebec Total
bonus 9.79 million 14.38 million 13.42 million 67.29 million 104.88 million
EB 7.37 bln 1.02 bln 1.46 bln 3.17 bln 13.02 bln
LFB 48.46 million 12.78 million 40.23 million 116.36 million 217.83 million
UFB 7.21 million 10.91 million 14.05 million 53.58 million 85.76 million
Pct exported: EB - 88.60, LFB - 33.51
Source: Export and Import Controls Bureau, Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade.
NOTE: EB = established base shipments, LFB = lower base fee, UFB = upper base fee.

From April 1, Canadian lumber exports which exceed quarterly or annual quotas are subject to export fees. Exports above 14.7 billion board feet annually or 4.226 billion board feet quarterly are subject to US$50 fee for every 1,000 board feet. If such excess exports exceed 650 million board feet, they are subject to a US$100 fee for every 1,000 board feet.
Export quotas are allocated for each province on a company-by-company basis. Shippers who have not been given an allocation are subject to the US$100 fee for any lumber they export.
This export data is based on Canadian export permits. There is a one-week lag between the entry of softwood lumber into the United States and the application for a Canadian permit.
((Reuters Ottawa Bureau (613) 235-6745))
